channel.title: Congrats to srt8!
channel.description: She is our latest Global Moderator! I'm sure she will do a fine job, and we need the help. ;D

item.title: Congrats to srt8!
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Topic is locked. Thank you everybody.

Read full topic

item.title: Congrats to srt8!
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“dragonfire455, post:86, topic:271582”][quote author=io9 link=topic=358391.msg2737779#msg2737779 date=1239139681]

[quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=358391.msg2737609#msg2737609 date=1239135218]

Okay everyone, I’m a gm and that’s all there is to it. I had a feeling this would cause problems, but mitb made the decision. No, I don’t have any experience moderating and I really don’t know anyone personally but that doesn’t matter. That is why I will make a good mod because I will treat everyone fairly. And hello, I live with mitb so I can ask him any questions about whatever since we are normally side by side on our laptops, so I will learn quickly. Plus, my main responsibility is to handle the sponsored service page then help with any moderating.
[/quote]I’ve been waiting for this day since the first month I joined this community. You will make a great Global Mod, I’m sure of it.

She wasn’t even here when you joined this forum, furfag.
[/quote]That doesn’t matter, it was a compliment. I do not need you to tell me otherwise and when I was registered and likewise for her. I would LOVE to continue this conversation on how you consider me a “furfag” but I’d rather not get a warn.[/quote]
furfag
[center] Do you have to encourage it? Honestly…[/center]

Read full topic

item.title: Congrats to srt8!
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

Okay everyone, I’m a gm and that’s all there is to it. I had a feeling this would cause problems, but mitb made the decision. No, I don’t have any experience moderating and I really don’t know anyone personally but that doesn’t matter. That is why I will make a good mod because I will treat everyone fairly. And hello, I live with mitb so I can ask him any questions about whatever since we are normally side by side on our laptops, so I will learn quickly. Plus, my main responsibility is to handle the sponsored service page then help with any moderating.
[/quote]I’ve been waiting for this day since the first month I joined this community. You will make a great Global Mod, I’m sure of it.

She wasn’t even here when you joined this forum, furfag.[/quote]That doesn’t matter, it was a compliment. I do not need you to tell me otherwise and when I was registered and likewise for her. I would LOVE to continue this conversation on how you consider me a “furfag” but I’d rather not get a warn.
[center] Grave digging. If you want to settle it than do it through pm instead of here.[/center]

item.title: Congrats to srt8!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I can’t believe none of you know what SRT8 is or means. She is my wife to be you know? How you didn’t assume it was something to do with mopar is beyond me. SRT is behind some of the best cars to be made these days, mostly costing a fraction of the price of foreign cars yet performing vastly better. Mopar is still, the best.

en.wikipedia.org

Street & Racing Technology

Street & Racing Technology (commonly called SRT) is a high-performance automobile group within Fiat Chrysler Automobiles. SRT began as "Team Viper" to develop the Dodge Viper. It later merged with "Team Prowler", the developers of the Plymouth Prowler, to become Specialty Vehicle Engineering (SVE). This was renamed Performance Vehicle Operations (PVO) in January 2002. Since all PVO vehicles used the SRT name, the PVO development group was renamed SRT in 2004. SRT heavily tunes and produces veh Th...

This is one example of a Dodge Charger SRT8:

800px-Dodge_Charger_SRT-8.jpg800×600

As to the pronunciation, you say each letter independently, S-R-T-8.

Read full topic
